hypothesis_content.title: Intraday V-Shaped Reversal After High-Volume Liquidation Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-volume, sharp price decline (or rise) within a single 1-hour candle that triggers significant liquidations (> $50M in 1h for BTC), a rapid, V-shaped partial retracement (> 50% of the initial spike move) will occur within the next 3 hours, providing a quick mean reversion scalp.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, high-volume moves fueled by liquidations often overshoot due to forced selling/buying. Once the liquidation cascade subsides, natural bid/ask imbalance and opportunistic buying/selling often cause a partial retracement. This is a micro-structure mean reversion play.
entry_conditions: Any regime (including STRESS, but tested separately)
1h candle has absolute return > 3% and volume > 150% of 20-period average
Estimated 1h liquidation volume (from derivatives data) exceeds $50M for BTC or proportional for ETH
Entry on the close of the spike candle, in the direction opposite the spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial spike candle's range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 1.5x the spike candle's range in the adverse direction (beyond the spike extreme)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The retracement fails to reach 50% of the initial spike move in more than 60% of cases within the 3-hour window, indicating the move is sustained or leads to a new trend rather than a reversion.
